title: Financial Partnership
description: Assess the overall health of your financial partnership

questions.text: I feel satisfied with how we handle money as a couple.

therapeutic.rationale: Overall satisfaction with your financial partnership is the bottom line. This captures whether your approach—whatever it is—is working for you.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: A satisfaction gap is a clear signal for conversation. The less satisfied partner can identify what would help.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared satisfaction with how you handle money indicates a healthy financial partnership.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: On a scale of 1-10, how satisfied are you with how you handle money together? What would raise it?

questions.text: I trust that money won't come between us.

therapeutic.rationale: Trust that money won't damage your relationship provides security. This confidence allows you to face financial challenges without fear.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner worries about money coming between you, explore what drives that fear. Past experiences? Current tensions?
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared trust that money won't threaten your relationship creates deep security.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: Do you ever worry that money could come between you? What would help address that?

questions.text: I feel my partner and I are building something meaningful together financially.

therapeutic.rationale: Feeling like you're building something meaningful—whatever that means to you—gives financial life purpose. Without this sense, money management feels like chores.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner doesn't feel you're building something meaningful, explore what would create that sense. What are you building toward?
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared sense of building something meaningful creates motivation and partnership.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What are you building financially? Does it feel meaningful to you?

questions.text: I believe our financial partnership makes us stronger as a couple.

therapeutic.rationale: Belief that handling money together strengthens your bond reflects healthy integration of finances and relationship. When money weakens connection, something needs attention.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner doesn't feel strengthened by financial partnership, explore what would help. Is money a source of connection or disconnection?
therapeutic.whenSame: Mutual belief that financial partnership strengthens you is a relationship asset.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: Does handling money together bring you closer or create distance?

questions.text: I feel hopeful about what we can accomplish together financially.

therapeutic.rationale: Hope about your financial future together provides motivation and resilience. This forward-looking optimism helps you persist through challenges.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner is less hopeful, explore specific concerns. Hope can be built through shared vision and small wins.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared hope about what you can accomplish together is a powerful motivator.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What do you hope to accomplish financially together? What would make that possible?
